metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7977 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ntpd in NTP before 4.2.8p6 and 4.3.x before 4.3.90 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a ntpdc reslist command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7977` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3').
